It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of showy, spurred flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and is native to regions in southern Europe and western Asia. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and can thrive in well-drained soil with full sun exposure.
